p: Another intranasal-administered peptide, EK1, which contains the heptad-repeat HR2 from the binding motif of the S protein has inhibited infection by many human coronaviruses ( 46); its administration in mice reduced lung viral titers by 1,000-fold 2014 ( 76) and its lipidation, EK1C4, resulted in much greater potency, inhibiting the cell-cell fusion mediated by S protein with IC 50 of 4.3 nM; its protective effect manifested half an hour after and 6 hours before exposure to coronavirus ( 46).
